channel.title: 14th February
channel.description: A world where everyone holds the power to employ science and creativity for good.

item.title: Phenomena: A Beginner’s Guide to Love and Physics. 14th February, Albany Theatre
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: We want to know it all: the whole universe and everything in it.  We want to learn how it all works.  We are asking you to show us.  We will listen.  We will pay attention.  If we follow what you tell us.  We can learn how to love. Uncover Theatre Read more…
item.content:encoded:
We want to know it all: the whole universe and everything in it. 

We want to learn how it all works. 

We are asking you to show us. 

We will listen. 

We will pay attention.

 If we follow what you tell us. 

We can learn how to love.

Uncover Theatre is a group of teenagers that make large-scale ensemble performances. They are an organised chaos, energetic and raw. Sounds like Chaos and Uncover Theatre devise theatre together that relates to young people and shares, with adults, their ideas about the world.

 

This is how they feel about love.
Sounds like Chaos are Gemma Rowan and Roisin Feeny

Saturday 14 February: this show will be followed with a Valentine’s after party ‘til 10.30pm.

TICKETS: http://www.thealbany.org.uk/event_detail/1379/Theatre/Phenomena:-A-Beginner%27s-Guide-to-Love-&-Physics
